Declare types in namespaces
Move 'IJarRepository' into a named namespace.
Remove the default parameter value to match the signature of overridden method.
'System.Exception' should not be thrown by user code.

CA1050.fullDescription: Types are declared in namespaces to prevent name collisions and as a way to organize related types in an object hierarchy.

CS8618.shortDescription: Non-nullable field must contain a non-null value when exiting constructor. Consider adding the 'required' modifier or declaring as nullable.

CS8625.shortDescription: Cannot convert null literal to non-nullable reference type.

S1006.shortDescription: Method overrides should not change parameter defaults
S1006.fullDescription: Default arguments are determined by the static type of the object. If a default argument is different for a parameter in an overriding method, the value used in the call will be different when calls are made via the base or derived object, which may be contrary to developer expectations.

S112.shortDescription: General exceptions should never be thrown
S112.fullDescription: Throwing such general exceptions as Exception, SystemException, ApplicationException, IndexOutOfRangeException, NullReferenceException, OutOfMemoryException and ExecutionEngineException prevents calling methods from handling true, system-generated exceptions differently than application-generated errors.

S3903.shortDescription: Types should be defined in named namespaces
S3903.fullDescription: Types are declared in namespaces in order to prevent name collisions and as a way to organize them into the object hierarchy. Types that are defined outside any named namespace are in a global namespace that cannot be referenced in code.
